text:
A woman of Payithamparai near Musiri on Monday attempted self immolation at the Collectorate here on Monday, demanding various welfare measures of the government.

Saraswathi (60), wife of Arangarajan, who had come to the Collectorate to present a petition at the grievance day meet, suddenly took out a kerosene bottle and poured kerosene on her body. However, before she could light herself up, a few officials and police overpowered her. She was taken to a police station. She said that though she had visited the Collectorate on many occasions demanding Old Age Pension, Widow Pension and other welfare assistance, no proper action had been taken on her petition. — Special Correspondent
title: Self-immolation bid
